Description: Sets the name of the server as shown on the server list
Name that the server uses in-game (for example, for chat messages)
Sets the password for clients to connect to the server. Default is no password (blank)

Sets the password that clients of the [admin interface](https://github.com/OpenTTD/OpenTTD/blob/master/docs/admin_network.md) need to use it. Default is no password (blank), meaning the admin interface is disabled
Sets the time interval for autosaves on the server
If set, the server will autosave on exit
Sets the savename of a game to load on server start. Both saved games and scenarios can be loaded. If no game savename is specified, a new game is started
Sets the random seed for creating a new game
Maximum number of players that may connect to the server at one time
Sets the minimum number of active players, below which the server will be automatically paused
Sets the maximum number of companies on the server
Enables admin chat on the server
Sets the currency for the server. If Custom is selected, the Custom Server Currency must also be set
Sets a custom currency for the server, if "Custom" is selected under Server Currency
Sets the number of AI competitors to be created on the server
Sets the quantity of towns created on a new map. If "Custom" is selected, Custom Town Quantity must also be set
If "Custom" is selected for Town Quantity, sets the exact number of towns to be created on a new map
Sets the frequency (or density) of industries created on a new map

Sets the maximum initial loan (in GBP) for a new game. If the Server Currency is different, the amount will be converted at the relevant exchange rate. The maximum loan amount will increase over time if Inflation is enabled
Sets the initial interest rate charged on loans for a new map
Sets the running (maintenance) costs level for all vehicles
Sets the speed at which the AI competitors will build (assuming AI competitors are not disabled)
Sets the frequency at which vehicles break down in the game
Sets the time period in years for subsidies offered in-game. 0 = subsidies disabled
Sets the bonus multiplier for subsidies offered in-game (assuming they are not disabled)
Sets the cost of construction in-game
Sets the terrain type for generating a new map
Sets the sea level, and as a result the size of the area covered by seas and lakes on a new map. If "Custom" is selected, Custom Sea Level must also be set
If "Custom" is selected for Sea Level, sets roughly the percentage area covered by seas and lakes on a new map
If enabled, economic recessions can occur on new maps
If enabled, trains can reverse at the end of line only, and not at stations
If enabled, disasters can occur on a new map

Sets the council's attitude toward area restructuring in the game. The less tolerant the council, the faster player ratings will fall due to town asset demolition. The ratings will improve over time by effectively moving freight, mail and people to and from stations in the town's area of control. Players rated poor or worse by the council cannot place stations or demolish town roads, bridges or buildings
Sets how towns should build their roads
If enabled, towns are allowed to build roads. Otherwise, players must build roads for a town to grow
Sets whether towns can be founded during the game and, if so, whether they will use the road layout used by other towns in the game, or can have a custom road layout
If enabled, towns are allowed to build level crossings
Sets the algorithm for generating cargo from houses
If enabled, the number of airports that can be placed in the vicinity of a town is not fixed, but depends upon their noise level, their distance to the town centre and the town's attitude
If enabled, inflation, as in the real world, will cause prices to go up as time passes
If enabled, two or more industries of the same type can be built on land that comes under the jurisdiction of one town. Normally only one of each type is allowed
If enabled, bribing of local authorities to increase a company's rating in that locality is allowed
If enabled, allows buying of exclusive transport rights in the area of a local authority
If enabled, allows funding of new commercial buildings, expanding a town's business district for around three months
If enabled, allows funding of urban road network reconstruction, causing considerable disruption to road traffic for up to six months
If enabled, allows a player to donate money to other companies

If enabled, allows a player to buy shares of other companies (or the whole other company, if it is AI controlled). The player must wait for the company to get old enough (around six years old) before buying 25% or effecting a full takeover
Minimal year to have passed in game befor you can buy shares of other companies
Select how fast towns should grow. You can also disable town growth
Amount of towns that will grow to city size. 0 = disabled
Remove absurd road-elements during the road construction

Controls whether infrastructure costs money to maintain. If maintenance of infrastructure is on, an amount, calculated from the number of tiles with rails, canals or locks, will be paid at regular intervals
If set, and vehicle breakdowns are disabled, vehicles will not go to depots or hangars for servicing

If set, only one vehicle is loaded at a time until full, before loading the next vehicle. When disabled, all vehicles in a station are loaded simultaineously, possibly needlessly blocking multiple platforms
If set, cargo will only be generated at a station when a vehicle with the capacity to pick that cargo up has visited. Affects station ratings
If enabled, a helicopter landing on a heliport or helipad will automatically be serviced by technicians stationed there
If set, vehicles will load cargo over a period of time, not full load instantly
Airports never expire

With this setting enabled, the catchment area around a 'station' varies depending on what type of station it is. For example, train stations have a larger catchment area than bus stations and airports' catchment areas are bigger still. It even varies with the type of airport; Intercontinental Airports have the biggest
It means that players can join stations that are separated from each other by a number of tiles as set in the station spread limit
Vehicle road side
Set the default or a more realistic acceleration calculation for trains. With this setting set to realistic, trains will travel faster up hill, but slower through tight corners

Set the default or a more realistic acceleration calculation for road vehicles. With this setting set to realistic. The power and tractive effort settings for vehicles only become meaningful with realistic acceleration, they will travel faster up hill, but slower through corners
Sets the steepness of slopes, trains will slow down more on slopes if this setting is set to a higher value. It only applies if the Realistic acceleration is selected
Sets the steepness of slopes, road vehicles will slow down more on slopes if this setting is set to a higher value. It only applies if the realistic acceleration is selected
Specifies the maximal allowed length of a train in tiles
This setting will stop vehicles from going out of date and so they will remain available until the very end of the game
Sets the maximum number of trains per player in the game at any one time
This patch allows you to increase or decrease the maximum amount of roadvehicals per player in the game at any one time
This patch allows you to increase or decrease the maximum amount of aircraft in the game, per player, at any one time
This patch allows you to increase or decrease the maximum amount of ships in the game, per player, at any one time
Sets whether speed limits should apply for wagons that set them. The default wagons in the game do not specify a maximum speed
Disable electical rails
The weight of freight trains is multiplied by the multiplier set here to simulate very heavy trains for more realism
Set the speed of aircraft in relation to rail, road and water vehicles. In plain TTD,
When enabled, this feature allows multiple NewGRF vehicle sets to exist side-by-side
Sets the probability of plane crashes
Extends every vehicles life by the number of years specified
When this switch is on the service intervals are considered to be in percents of the max. reliability rather than days.
The default service interval when a new train is built.
The default service interval when a new road vehicle is built
The default service interval when a new ship is built
The default service interval when a new aircraft is built.
Sets the starting year
The value set to this parameter represents the year the server will restart
Sets the town name Language
Sets max map height
This setting allows you to determine at what altitude snow will appear
Year the game will end
This specifies the land generation system that you use, either the Original or Terra Genesis Perlin (TGP)
This option determines the maximum allowed distance (in tiles) from the edge of the map for an Oil Refinery
Sets the smoothness
This sets the variety of distribution
The Map size determines the size and shape of your map
The Map size determines the size and shape of your map
Bitset of the borders that are water by creating an new game
sets minimum river length
Sets total amount of rivers
Sets the server branch to install. NOTE: Update the server after switching branches!
